xwikidoc.name: medsavantArchive20130531
xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #medsavant on 31 May 2013
xwikidoc.content: <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant 11:36 <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant 14:58 <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant 16:14 <BogdanVancea> has joined #medsavant 16:15 <sdumitriu> Hey BogdanVancea 16:15 <BogdanVancea> hello, sdumitriu 16:15 <BogdanVancea> :) 16:15 <BogdanVancea> how are you? 16:15 <sdumitriu> Good 16:15 <sdumitriu> Productive 16:16 <sdumitriu> The MedSavant build should work now in any IDE 16:16 <sdumitriu> At least it works for me in Eclipse 16:16 <sdumitriu> And it works from the command line 16:17 <BogdanVancea> awesome 16:17 <sdumitriu> You should test it 16:17 <BogdanVancea> I just pulled everything from git 16:18 <BogdanVancea> awesome 16:18 <BogdanVancea> I see you've moved all the icons 16:18 <BogdanVancea> in the resource folder 16:18 <sdumitriu> Yep 16:18 <BogdanVancea> after you left yesterday 16:18 <BogdanVancea> I bounced into the problem 16:18 <BogdanVancea> and was to lazy to move everything 16:18 <BogdanVancea> just renamed with iconroot variable 16:19 <BogdanVancea> the project is so nice and organized now 16:19 <BogdanVancea> :D 16:19 <sdumitriu> Eh, there's still work to do 16:20 <BogdanVancea> ;)) 16:20 <BogdanVancea> there's always some work to be done 16:20 <BogdanVancea> how did you run it from the command line? 16:21 <sdumitriu> mvn clean install && cd MedSavantClient/target/ && java -jar medsavant-client-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar 16:23 <BogdanVancea> ah, cool 16:23 <BogdanVancea> I think I saw a .sh script somewhere 16:23 <BogdanVancea> it didn't work for me when I tried it, and I don't seem to find it now 16:26 <sdumitriu> Yeah, it was useless 16:26 <sdumitriu> I removed it 16:26 <BogdanVancea> I see 16:27 <BogdanVancea> btw, I just remembered that when I read the idea for the project 16:27 <BogdanVancea> you mentioned test driven development 16:27 <BogdanVancea> I haven't worked that way before 16:27 <BogdanVancea> how should that work? :) 16:28 <sdumitriu> :) 16:28 <sdumitriu> The idea is that before writing code, you have to define the specifications: what is the code supposed to do? 16:28 <sdumitriu> So you do that by writing actual tests 16:29 <sdumitriu> That call methods from your new class and verify the output 16:29 <sdumitriu> MedSavant has 0 tests :( 16:29 <BogdanVancea> ah 16:29 <BogdanVancea> ;)) 16:29 <BogdanVancea> hmm 16:29 <BogdanVancea> are JUnit tests ok? 16:30 <sdumitriu> Yes 16:30 <sdumitriu> https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/blob/master/components/patient-measurements/api/src/test/java/edu/toronto/cs/phenotips/measurements/MeasurementsScriptServiceTest.java 16:30 <BogdanVancea> ah 16:30 <BogdanVancea> mockito 16:30 <BogdanVancea> awesome 16:30 <BogdanVancea> I can finally use it 16:30 <sdumitriu> And I really mean that you write the test before the code 16:30 <BogdanVancea> with an actual reason 16:30 <sdumitriu> Initially tests fail 16:31 <sdumitriu> After you write the test case, you need to make it compile by writing the class/methods under test 16:31 <sdumitriu> Then you have to write the method logic that makes the test pass 16:32 <BogdanVancea> I see 16:32 <BogdanVancea> so I don't need to mock the components I want to test? 16:33 <sdumitriu> Well, MedSavant doesn't have components either :( 16:33 <sdumitriu> But you can mock other class fields 16:33 <BogdanVancea> true 16:34 <BogdanVancea> I'm actually excited 16:34 <BogdanVancea> I didn't get the chance to do something like this before 16:34 <BogdanVancea> also, am I the only student admitted for developing on Medsavant? 16:35 <sdumitriu> No 16:35 <sdumitriu> There's another one, but so far he didn't reply 16:35 <sdumitriu> Probably offline 16:36 <sdumitriu> Travelling back to his country 16:36 <BogdanVancea> ah 16:36 <BogdanVancea> I see 16:36 <sdumitriu> I sent you something 16:36 <BogdanVancea> thanks, reading it now :) 16:38 <BogdanVancea> nice, this will be great for a read before bed 16:39 <sdumitriu> It's short, so it shouldn't take long to read 16:39 <sdumitriu> Anyway, the idea was to start with creating the Solr index, then start to code it 16:40 <BogdanVancea> makes sense 16:40 <BogdanVancea> should I index everything in solr? 16:40 <BogdanVancea> or would it be better to go gradually 16:41 <sdumitriu> Better gradually 16:41 <BogdanVancea> nice 16:42 <BogdanVancea> ICE is actually a mysql database, right? 16:42 <BogdanVancea> "modified" mysql 16:42 <sdumitriu> Yes 16:43 <sdumitriu> http://mail.medsavant.com/mailman/listinfo/notification -> You can subscribe to receive commit notifications, if you want 16:44 <BogdanVancea> thanks 17:13 <sdumitriu> So, how was the first week? 17:15 <BogdanVancea> pretty good 17:15 <BogdanVancea> I actually excepted to do more 17:15 <sdumitriu> Yes, you're gonna have to get used to it 17:15 <sdumitriu> Time flies 17:16 <BogdanVancea> true 17:17 <BogdanVancea> but I'm confident I'll improve my pace 17:17 <BogdanVancea> I never do manage to get a lot of things done in the first week 17:18 <BogdanVancea> doesn't really matter what I'm trying to do 18:18 <marta> has joined #medsavant 18:28 <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant
